intro: Cousinia stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf cousinia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and hairy, gray-green foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom in the summer months. It is adapted to thrive in harsh, dry environments with poor soil conditions. Cousinia stenophylla is often found in rocky slopes and gravelly plains, showcasing its resilience to extreme climates.
